llama2:70b_direct_sole-planning_results:
Sure, I'd be happy to help you create a 7-day travel itinerary for your trip to California! Here's a plan that includes visits to three different cities in California, accommodations, transportation, and dining recommendations, all within your budget of $7,200.

Day 1: Miami to Sacramento

* Fly from Miami to Sacramento on March 8th, 2022. You can book a flight on Flight Number F3658887 for $576 per person, which takes 5 hours and 3 minutes.
* Upon arrival, take a taxi or rideshare to your hotel, Holiday Inn Sacramento Downtown - Arena, which costs around $20-$30.
* Check-in at the hotel and freshen up.
* For dinner, head to Ella, a modern American bistro with a focus on seasonal ingredients and creative cocktails. A 3-course dinner for two people should cost around $100-$150.

Day 2: Sacramento

* Start your day at Temple Coffee Roasters, a popular spot for coffee and breakfast. You can get a coffee and pastry for around $5-$7.
* Visit Old Sacramento, a historic district with charming streets, shops, and eateries. Take a horse-drawn carriage ride or stroll along the riverfront.
* For lunch, head to The Firehouse Restaurant, a local favorite serving American cuisine in a historic firehouse building. A meal for two people should cost around $20-$30.
* Spend the afternoon exploring the California State Railroad Museum or taking a scenic bike ride along the Sacramento River Trail.
* For dinner, head to The Kitchen, a farm-to-table restaurant with a seasonal menu. A 3-course dinner for two people should cost around $100-$150.

Day 3: Sacramento to Los Angeles

* Take a self-driving car from Sacramento to Los Angeles, which takes around 5 hours and 55 minutes, covering a distance of 619 km. You can book a car through a rideshare service like Uber or Lyft for around $30-$40 per person.
* Alternatively, you can take a taxi for around $619.
* Check-in at your hotel, The Westin Bonaventure Hotel & Suites, which costs around $250-$300 per night.
* For dinner, head to Guerrilla Tacos, a popular spot for delicious tacos and drinks. A meal for two people should cost around $20-$30.

Day 4: Los Angeles

* Start your day at The Original Pantry Cafe, a famous diner serving American classics since 1924. You can get a breakfast platter and coffee for around $10-$15.
* Visit the Griffith Observatory, offering stunning views of LA and a planetarium show. Admission is free, but you can pay $7-$10 per person for a telescope viewing.
* For lunch, head to In-N-Out Burger, a California institution for fast food. A meal for two people should cost around $10-$15.
* Spend the afternoon exploring Hollywood, including the Walk of Fame, the Chinese Theatre, and the Dolby Theatre.
* For dinner, head to Bestia, an Italian restaurant with a focus on house-made pasta and seasonal ingredients. A 3-course dinner for two people should cost around $100-$150.

Day 5: Los Angeles

* Take a day trip to Santa Monica, which takes around 45 minutes by car or an hour by public transportation. You can book a rideshare service like Uber or Lyft for around $20-$30 per person or take the Metro Expo Line for $1.75 per person.
* Visit the Santa Monica Pier, a historic amusement park with an iconic Ferris wheel and arcade games. Admission is free, but rides and games cost around $5-$10 each.
* For lunch, head to The Lobster, a beachfront restaurant serving seafood and American cuisine. A meal for two people should cost around $30-$40.
* Spend the afternoon shopping along the Third Street Promenade or strolling along the beach.
* For dinner, head back to Los Angeles and try Animal, a creative American restaurant with a focus on seasonal ingredients. A 3-course dinner for two people should cost around $100-$150.

Day 6: Los Angeles

* Start your day at Verve Coffee Roasters, a popular spot for coffee and pastries. You can get a coffee and pastry for around $5-$7.
* Visit the Getty Center, a museum with an extensive collection of art and architecture. Admission is free, but you need to pay $20 per person for parking.
* For lunch, head to The Farm of Beverly Hills, a farm-to-table restaurant with a seasonal menu. A meal for two people should cost around $30-$40.
* Spend the afternoon exploring Rodeo Drive, a famous shopping street, or take a hike in Runyon Canyon Park for stunning views of LA.
* For dinner, head to Spago Beverly Hills, a Michelin-starred restaurant serving farm-to-table American cuisine. A 3-course dinner for two people should cost around $150-$200.

Day 7: Departure from Los Angeles

* Spend the morning relaxing at your hotel or exploring the nearby area.
* Depart for the airport and fly back to Miami on Flight Number F3658887 for $576 per person, which takes 5 hours and 3 minutes.

Budget Breakdown:

* Flights from Miami to Sacramento and Los Angeles: $1,152 (2 x $576)
* Accommodation for 6 nights: $1,400-$1,800 (avg. $233-$300 per night)
* Transportation (taxis, rideshares, or car rentals): $100-$200
* Food and dining recommendations: $600-$800 (avg. $100-$133 per meal)
* Attractions and activities: $200-$300 (avg. $30-$50 per person)
* Miscellaneous expenses (souvenirs, tips, etc.): $100-$200

Total budget: $7,200-$8,200

This itinerary should fit your budget of $7,200, allowing for some flexibility in case of unexpected expenses or changes in plans. You'll have plenty of opportunities to enjoy Mexican and American cuisine throughout your trip, and you'll get to visit some of California's most iconic destinations. Have a great trip!
